gurmukhi: ਚੁ ਦੀਸਮ ਕਿ ਨਾਹਰ ਬਿਯਾਮਦ ਬ ਜੰਗ || ਚਸ਼ੀਦਮ ਯਕੇ ਤੀਰਿ ਮਨ ਬੇਦਰੰਗ ||੨੯||
transliteration: Chu Deedam Kinaahar Biyaamad Ba Jan|| Chasheedam Yake Tdere Man Bedran||29||
translation: When I saw Nahar Khan in the battlefield, he was greeted with one of my arrows.29.

gurmukhi: ਹਮ ਅਾਖ਼ਿਰ ਗੁਰੇਜ਼ਦ ਬਜਾੲੇ ਮਸਾਫ਼ || ਬਸੇ ਖ਼ਾਨਹ ਖ਼ਰਦੰਦ ਬੇਰੂੰ ਗੁਜ਼ਾਫ਼ ||੩੦||
transliteration: Ham Aakhir Gurezad Bajaae Masaaf|| Bade Khaanah Khurdand Beroon Guzaaf||30||
translation: All those boasters who came near the wall, they were dispatched in no time.30.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਅਫ਼ਗਾਨ ਦੀਗਰ ਬਯਾਮਦ ਬਜੰਗ || ਚੁ ਸੈਲਿ ਰਵਾਂ ਹਮਚੁ ਤੀਰੋ ਤੁਫ਼ੰਗ ||੩੧||
transliteration: Ki Afgadn Deegad Bayaamad Bajan|| Chu Saile Ravaan Hamchu Teero Tufan||31||
translation: Another Afghan, with a bow and arrow came in the battlefield like a flood.31.

gurmukhi: ਬਸੇ ਹਮਲਹ ਕਰਦੰਦ ਬ ਮਰਦਾਨਗੀ || ਹਮ ਅਜ਼ ਹੋਸ਼ਗੀ ਹਮ ਜ਼ਿ ਦੀਵਾਨਗੀ ||੩੨||
transliteration: Bade Hamlah Kardand Ba Mardaanee|| Ham Az Hoshgiham Zi Deevaanee||32||
translation: He shot arrows heroically, sometimes in senses and sometimes in madness.32.

gurmukhi: ਬਸੇ ਹਮਲਹ ਕਰਦੋ ਬਸੇ ਜ਼ਖ਼ਮ ਖ਼ਰਦ || ਦੋ ਕਸ ਰਾ ਬਜਾਂ ਕਸ਼ਤ ਹਮ ਜਾਂ ਸਪੁਰਦ ||੩੩||
transliteration: Bade Hamlah Kardo Bade Zakhm Khurd|| Do Kas Raa Bajaan Kasht Ham Jaan Sapurd||33||
translation: He made several attacks and was drenched with last.33.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਅਾਂ ਖ਼੍ਵਾਜਹ ਮਰਦੂਦ ਸਾਯਹ ਦੀਵਾਰ || ਨਯਾਮਦ ਬ ਮੈਦਾਂ ਬ ਮਰਦਾਨਹ ਵਾਰ ||੩੪||
transliteration: Ki Aan Khvaajah Mardood Saayah Daavaar|| Nayaamad Ba Maidaan Ba Mardaanah Vaar||34||
translation: Khwaja Mardud hid himself behind the wall; he did not enter the field like a brave warrior.34.

gurmukhi: ਦਰੇਗ਼ਾ ਅਗਰ ਰੂੲਿ ਓ ਦੀਦਮੇ || ਬ ਯਕ ਤੀਰ ਲਾਚਾਰ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ੀਦਮੇ ||੩੫||
transliteration: Dareghaa Agad Rooe O Deedame|| Ba Yak Teer Laachaar Bakhsheedame||35||
translation: If I had seen his face once, one of my arrows would have dispatched him to the abode of death.35.

gurmukhi: ਹਮ ਅਾਖ਼ਿਰ ਬਸੇ ਜ਼ਖ਼ਮਿ ਤੀਰੋ ਤੁਫ਼ੰਗ || ਦੋ ਸੂੲੇ ਬਸੇ ਕੁਸ਼ਤਹ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਬੇਦਰੰਗ ||੩੬||
transliteration: Ham Aakhir Bade Zakhme Teero Tufan|| Do Sooe Bade Koushtah Shud Bedaran||36||
translation: Many warriors wounded with arrows and bullets died in the battle on both the sides.36.

gurmukhi: ਬਸੇ ਬਾਰ ਬਾਰੀਦ ਤੀਰੋ ਤੁਫ਼ੰਗ || ਜ਼ਿਮੀ ਗਸ਼ਤ ਹਮ ਚੂੰ ਗੁਲੇ ਲਾਲਹ ਰੰਗ ||੩੭||
transliteration: Bade Baar Bhareed Teero Tufan|| Zimigadht Ham Choon Gule Laalah Ran||37||
translation: The darts were showered so violently, that the field became red like popyflowers.37.

gurmukhi: ਸਰੋਪਾੲਿ ਅੰਬੋਹ ਚੰਦਾ ਸ਼ੁਦਹ || ਕਿ ਮੈਦਾਂ ਪੁਰ ਅਜ਼ ਗੂਓ ਚੌਗਾਂ ਸ਼ੁਦਹ ||੩੮||
transliteration: Daro-paae Anboh Channdaa Shudah|| Ki Maidaan Poun Az Gooo Chaougadn Shudah||38||
translation: The heads and limbs of the dead were scattered in the field like the balls and sticks in the game of Polo.38.

gurmukhi: ਤਰੰਕਾਰਿ ਤੀਰੋ ਤਫੰਗਿ ਕਮਾਂ || ਬਰਾਮਦ ਯਕੇ ਹਾਓ ਹੂ ਅਜ਼ ਜਹਾਂ ||੩੯||
transliteration: Tarankar(i) Teero Taphane Kamaan|| Baraamad Yake Haao Goo Az Jahaan||39||
translation: When the arrows hissed and bows tinkled, there was a great hue and cry in the world.39.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਗਰ ਸ਼ੋਰਸ਼ਿ ਕੈਬਰਿ ਕੀਨਹ ਕੋਸ਼ || ਜ਼ਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਮਰਦਾਂ ਬਿਰੂੰ ਰਫ਼ਤ ਹੋਸ਼ ||੪੦||
transliteration: Digad Shorashe Kaibar(i) Keenah Kosh|| Zi Mardaane Mardaan Biroon Rafat Hosh||40||
translation: There the spears and lances provided a dreadful sound and the warriors lost heir senses.40.

gurmukhi: ਹਮ ਅਾਖ਼ਿਰ ਚਿਹ ਮਰਦੀ ਕੁਨਦ ਕਾਰਜ਼ਾਰ || ਕਿ ਬਰ ਚਿਹਲ ਤਨ ਅਾਯਦਸ਼ ਬੇ ਸ਼ੁਮਾਰ ||੪੧||
transliteration: Ham Aakheer Hih Mardikounad Kaarzaar|| Ki Bar Chihal Tan Aayadash Be Shoumaar||41||
translation: How could bravery ultimately withstand in the field, when only forty were surrounded by innumerable warriors?41.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਾਗ਼ਿ ਜਹਾਂ ਚੂੰ ਸ਼ੁਦਹ ਬੁਰਕਹ ਪੋਸ਼ || ਸ਼ਹਿ ਸ਼ਬ ਬਰਾਮਦ ਹਮਹ ਜਲਵਹ ਜੋਸ਼ ||੪੨||
transliteration: Charaaghe Jahaan Choon Shudah Burkah Posh|| Shaih Shab Baraamad Hamah Jalvah Josh||42||
translation: When the lamp of the world veiled itself, the moon shone in brightness during the night.42.
